Question: In 1612, this person was called as a witness in Bellott v.
Hints: It was prefaced with a poem by Ben Jonson, in which this person is hailed, presciently, as "not of an age, but for all time.".
As a result, critics of the time mostly rated this person below John Fletcher and Ben Jonson.
The actors in this person's company included the famous Richard Burbage, William Kempe, Henry Condell and John Heminges.
